item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "So we beat on, boats against the current, borne back ceaselessly into the past." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "There must have been moments even that afternoon when Daisy tumbled short of his dreams -- not through her own fault, but because of the colossal vitality of his illusion. It had gone beyond her, beyond everything. He had thrown himself into it with a creative passion, adding to it all the time, decking it out with every bright feather that drifted his way. No amount of fire or freshness can challenge what a man will store up in his ghostly heart." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Things are sweeter when they're lost. I know--because once I wanted something and got it. It was the only thing I ever wanted badly, Dot, and when I got it it turned to dust in my hand." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "There's no beauty without poignancy and there's no poignancy without the feeling that it's going, men, names, books, houses--bound for dust--mortal--" -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Ian McEwan
item.description: "It wasn't only wickedness and scheming that made people unhappy, it was confusion and misunderstanding; above all, it was the failure to grasp the simple truth that other people are as real as you." -- Ian McEwan

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "It has shown me that everything is illuminated in the light of the past. It is always along the side of us...on the inside, looking out." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Julia Glass
item.description: "There you are, diligently swimming a straight line, minding the form of your strokes, when you look up and see, always a shock, the currents you can't even feel have pulled you off course." -- Julia Glass

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Au milieu de l'hiver, j'apprenais enfin qu'il y avait en moi un été invincible." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "In the depth of winter, I finally learned that within me there lay an invincible summer." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "If you only read the books that everyone else is reading, you can only think what everyone else is thinking." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "Perhaps everybody has a garden of Eden, I don't know; but they have scarcely seen their garden before they see the flaming sword. Then, perhaps, life only offers the choice of remembering the garden or forgetting it. Either, or: it takes strength to remember, it takes another kind of strength to forget, it takes a hero to do both. People who remember court madness through pain, the pain of the perpetually recurring death of their innocence; people who forget court another kind of madness, the madness of the denial of pain and the hatred of innocence; and the world is mostly divided between madmen who remember and madmen who forget. Heroes are rare." -- James Baldwin

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "For nothing is more unbearable, once one has it, than freedom." -- James Baldwin

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Jeannette Walls
Elizabeth add a quote by Jeannette Walls
item.description: "Life is a drama full of tragedy and comedy. You should learn to enjoy the comic episodes a little more." -- Jeannette Walls

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "It'd be a good setting to jump overboard,' said Dick mildly. 'Wouldn't it?' agreed Nicole hastily. 'Let's borrow life-preservers and jump over. I think we should do something spectacular. I feel that all our lives have been too restrained." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "Of course, I'm being rude. I'm spoiling the ending, not only of the entire book, but of this particular piece of it. I have given you two events in advance, because I don't have much interest in building mystery. Mystery bores me. It chores me. I know what happens and so do you. It's the machinations that wheel us there that aggravate, perplex, interest, and astound me. There are many things to think of. There is much story." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Without music, life would be a mistake." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "Let us read, and let us dance; these two amusements will never do any harm to the world." -- Voltaire

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "What'll we do with ourselves this afternoon?” cried Daisy, “and the day after that, and the next thirty years?" -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "Do not read, as children do, to amuse yourself, or like the ambitious, for the purpose of instruction. No, read in order to live." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Here's to alcohol, the rose colored glasses of life." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Everywhere we go and move on and change, something's lost--something's left behind. You can't ever quite repeat anything, and I've been so yours, here--" -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Art isn't meaningless... It is in itself. It isn't in that it tries to make life less so." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "I learned a little of beauty-- enough to know that it had nothing to do with truth..." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "And that taught me you can't have anything, you can't have anything at all. Because desire just cheats you. It's like a sunbeam skipping here and there about a room. It stops and gilds some inconsequential object, and we poor fools try to grasp it - but when we do the sunbeam moves on to something else, and you've got the inconsequential part, but the glitter that made you want it is gone." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald
